channel.title: Add delay time for bootstrapping process with Bridges, in Gateway
channel.description: Hi, I use bridges for obfs3 bridges for Tor Browser Bundle, because usual bridges don't work here. But when I make Whonix use them, Whonix bootstrapping gets stuck at some percentage and keeps stuck at that percentage without continuously trying. I have slow internet connection, but TBB has some "waiting" delay time (I think) until bootstrap complete even with slow obfs3 bridges. Can you please tell me a way to make Whonix gateway do the same? Thanks.

item.title: Add delay time for bootstrapping process with Bridges, in Gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
whonixcheck waits up to 60 seconds.

It is currently only be changed by editing the code.

Whonix 8:

github.com

Whonix/Whonix/blob/Whonix8/whonix_shared/usr/lib/whonix/whonixcheck/19_2_check_tor_bootstrap#L232

    

  1.       ## successfully finished the Tor bootstrap test.
    2. 

  2.       return 0
    3. 

  3.    fi
    4. 

  4.    $output ${output_opts[@]} --passivepopupqueuex --typex "info" --titlecli "$TITLE" --message "$MSG" --done
    5. 

  5.    ## Only attempt to close the progress bar if one was started.
    6. 

  6.    ## Otherwise this might conflict with the progress bar in 25_autostart.
    7. 

  7.    $output ${output_opts[@]} --waitmessagecli --typecli "info" --titlex "$TITLE" --message "$MSG" --done
    8. 

  8.    return 0
    9. 

  9. fi
    10. 

  10. 

    11. 

  11. wait_max="60"
    12. 

  12. 

    13. 

  13. if [ "$TOR_BOOTSTRAP_TIME_PASSED" -gt "1" ]; then
    14. 

  14.    if [ ! "$started_tor_bootstrap_progress_bar" = "1" ]; then
    15. 

  15.       if [ "$DAEMON" = "1" ]; then
    16. 

  16.          ## Daemon mode. Not creating a progress bar.
    17. 

  17.          true
    18. 

  18.       else
    19. 

  19.          ## Not running in daemon mode.
    20. 

  20.          started_tor_bootstrap_progress_bar="1"
    21. 

  21.          ## Waited for more than 5 seconds.
    22.

Whonix 9
https://github.com/Whonix/whonixcheck/blob/master/usr/lib/whonixcheck/check_tor_bootstrap#L108

It would be trivial to make this configurable by /etc/whonix.d. Or if useful the timeout can be increased. But are you sure it’s a timeout problem?

Can you start whonixcheck in terminal please and post the log here?

And you can always restart whonixcheck. Should the bridge be connected by then, it will detect that.

The timeout whonixcheck has is just one for checking what’s up. The timeout doesn’t prevent you from connecting or something like that. If you want so, what whonixcheck says doesn’t matter. It has been created a a helper, for diagnose, for advice, for debugging, for usability.

Also check Tor’s log /var/log/tor/log.
